notes.body: Hello Rudresh,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologise for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.     Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '9650044928' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information. Also, if you have a dual SIM phone, I would request you to help us with the second number as well, we will forward a request for the other number as well.      Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email ID too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.     I certainly hope this helps, and I appreciate your understanding and patience in the meantime.     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!     Regards,  Habiba
notes.body_html:
Hello Rudresh,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologise for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.

Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '9650044928' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information. Also, if you have a dual SIM phone, I would request you to help us with the second number as well, we will forward a request for the other number as well. 

Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email ID too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.

I certainly hope this helps, and I appreciate your understanding and patience in the meantime.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!

Regards,
Habiba

notes.body: Hello Ashok,        Greetings from PharmEasy!     I understand your concern regarding the refund for #649088047963090944-42230. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you, and I will surely assist you with the same.     I see that a refund of Rs. 217.20 has been initiated on 17th November 2025. The refund has been credited to your payment source. You may track your refund via ARN number: 568708580654.     If you have still not received the refund, we kindly request you to share the bank statement which linked to Paytm for the period from 16th November 2025 to the present date. This will help us investigate the issue further and take appropriate action.     Awaiting your earliest response.     Regards,  Habiba
notes.body_html:

Greetings from PharmEasy!

I see that a refund of Rs. 217.20 has been initiated on 17th November 2025. The refund has been credited to your payment source. You may track your refund via ARN number: 568708580654.

If you have still not received the refund, we kindly request you to share the bank statement which linked to Paytm for the period from 16th November 2025 to the present date. This will help us investigate the issue further and take appropriate action.

notes.body: Hi Team,     After reviewing the details, we confirm that the issue occurred due to an oversight by the doctor. The customer had requested a chat-based consultation, during which no consultation call is made. In this mode, the doctor collects all necessary updated information through chat and then prepares the prescription (Rx) accordingly.  However, the doctor did not add the required medicine to the prescription. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused. We will be sharing this feedback with the doctor to ensure such issues do not occur again.

notes.body: Hello Sumaiya,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  Thank you for your time on the call. Pursuant to our conversation, a refund of Rs. 121.33 was initiated to your account on 24.11.2025. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.      Please note that the refund might not be shown in the UPI account and the same is credited to your bank account. Kindly check your bank account and wait till the above timeframe. If you still have not received the refund, please contact us by sharing your bank statement in PDF format from 23.11.2025 till date to check further.      In the future, please contact our Level 1 customer service team via a call to 8071324888 or send an email to care@pharmeasy.in. If your query remains unresolved for 7 days after you have reached out to our Level 1 Customer support, you can escalate the matter to us.    For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.  Regards, Grievance Officer HelpDesk.
notes.body_html:
Hello Sumaiya,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

Thank you for your time on the call. Pursuant to our conversation, a refund of Rs. 121.33 was initiated to your account on 24.11.2025. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this. 

Please note that the refund might not be shown in the UPI account and the same is credited to your bank account. Kindly check your bank account and wait till the above timeframe. If you still have not received the refund, please contact us by sharing your bank statement in PDF format from 23.11.2025 till date to check further. 

In the future, please contact our Level 1 customer service team via a call to 8071324888 or send an email to care@pharmeasy.in. If your query remains unresolved for 7 days after you have reached out to our Level 1 Customer support, you can escalate the matter to us. 

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.

Regards,
Grievance Officer HelpDesk.

notes.body: Hello Afrid,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is with reference to the concern raised for order #654538673382727680-77213.     We have received an update from our logistics team. As per the update, your order has been delivered to you. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you. We have shared the required feedback with the delivery agent and we will make sure that such instances are not repeated in the future.     Please consider this as a one-off instance as we aim to provide the best of services to our customers and such instances are very rare.     Since you are a valued customer, as a token of apology, we have credited Rs.30/- to your PharmEasy wallet on  03 December 2025.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. PharmEasy looks forward to bettering your experience in the future.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.      Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,   PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Afrid,

Greetings from PharmEasy!
 
This email is with reference to the concern raised for order #654538673382727680-77213.
 
We have received an update from our logistics team. As per the update, your order has been delivered to you. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you. We have shared the required feedback with the delivery agent and we will make sure that such instances are not repeated in the future.
 
Please consider this as a one-off instance as we aim to provide the best of services to our customers and such instances are very rare.

Since you are a valued customer, as a token of apology, we have credited Rs.30/- to your PharmEasy wallet on  03 December 2025.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. PharmEasy looks forward to bettering your experience in the future.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 
 
Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards, 
PharmEasy

 The News Explained 
 
 02, Dec 2025 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Greetings, dear readers, 
 
We are back with the Firstpost newsletter, “The News Explained”, that answers the many questions that come to your mind as you scan through the headlines. Today, in India, the “Sanchar Saathi” app created quite the buzz. The government has directed phone manufacturers to pre-install the application on all devices sold in the country. However, after much hullabaloo, Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia clarified that users will have the option to delete this app. What is Sanchar Saathi? We explain. 
 
In today’s edition, we also discuss Vladimir Putin’s upcoming India trip, Donald Trump’s MRI, and Pakistan’s failed ‘aid diplomacy’. 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1
 
 
 
 Why Indian govt wants smartphone makers to pre-install an app on all devices 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 In a move to boost India’s cybersecurity, the telecom ministry has told smartphone companies to pre-install a government-developed 'Sanchar Saathi' app on every new device and also roll out a software update to add the app on existing devices. The mandate had triggered strong pushback from Opposition leaders, who say the move could open the door to state surveillance. However, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has now clarified that the app can be deleted by the user 

 Read
 Full Article 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2
 
 
 
 After success of Russia’s S-400 in Op Sindoor, why India wants its more advanced version 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 India and Russia enjoy an enduring defence partnership, with both sides looking to boost this cooperation when Vladimir Putin visits India on December 4-5. A possible deal on the S-500, the more advanced version of the S-400, is on the cards. This comes after the air defence system proved its worth during Operation Sindoor when it struck down Pakistani jets 

 Read
 Full Article 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3
 
 
 
 Why Trump’s MRI tests and ‘healthy’ diagnosis raise more questions about his fitness 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 Since US President Donald Trump returned to the White House in January, there has been growing speculation about his physical condition. Here’s why news about Trump’s recent magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) test in October is raising more questions 

 Read
 Full Article 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4
 
 
 
 Did Pakistan send expired goods to Sri Lanka as flood relief? 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 Pakistan's relief shipment to Sri Lanka, which is battling the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah, has sparked a controversy. Images circulating online showed cartons of food and supplies that appear to be past their expiry date. The pictures have unleashed a wave of criticism on social media, with flood-hit Colombo reportedly conveying its displeasure to Islamabad through formal and informal channels 

 Read
 Full Article 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5
 
 
 
 Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner: Trump’s unconventional negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine 
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 Today (December 2) marks a pivotal moment in the negotiations to end the Russia-Ukraine war. The US is dispatching two negotiators to Moscow to meet Vladimir Putin. But who has Trump appointed for this important task? His old ‘golf buddy’ Steve Witkoff, who is also his West Asia special envoy, and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner 

 Read
 Full Article

helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
View in browser
The News Explained
02, Dec 2025
Greetings, dear readers,

We are back with the Firstpost newsletter, “The News Explained”, that answers the many questions that come to your mind as you scan through the headlines. Today, in India, the “Sanchar Saathi” app created quite the buzz. The government has directed phone manufacturers to pre-install the application on all devices sold in the country. However, after much hullabaloo, Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia clarified that users will have the option to delete this app. What is Sanchar Saathi? We explain.

In today’s edition, we also discuss Vladimir Putin’s upcoming India trip, Donald Trump’s MRI, and Pakistan’s failed ‘aid diplomacy’.
1

Why Indian govt wants smartphone makers to pre-install an app on all devices

In a move to boost India’s cybersecurity, the telecom ministry has told smartphone companies to pre-install a government-developed 'Sanchar Saathi' app on every new device and also roll out a software update to add the app on existing devices. The mandate had triggered strong pushback from Opposition leaders, who say the move could open the door to state surveillance. However, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has now clarified that the app can be deleted by the user
Read Full Article
2

After success of Russia’s S-400 in Op Sindoor, why India wants its more advanced version

India and Russia enjoy an enduring defence partnership, with both sides looking to boost this cooperation when Vladimir Putin visits India on December 4-5. A possible deal on the S-500, the more advanced version of the S-400, is on the cards. This comes after the air defence system proved its worth during Operation Sindoor when it struck down Pakistani jets
Read Full Article
3

Why Trump’s MRI tests and ‘healthy’ diagnosis raise more questions about his fitness

Since US President Donald Trump returned to the White House in January, there has been growing speculation about his physical condition. Here’s why news about Trump’s recent magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) test in October is raising more questions
Read Full Article
4

Did Pakistan send expired goods to Sri Lanka as flood relief?

Pakistan's relief shipment to Sri Lanka, which is battling the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah, has sparked a controversy. Images circulating online showed cartons of food and supplies that appear to be past their expiry date. The pictures have unleashed a wave of criticism on social media, with flood-hit Colombo reportedly conveying its displeasure to Islamabad through formal and informal channels
Read Full Article
5

Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner: Trump’s unconventional negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine

Today (December 2) marks a pivotal moment in the negotiations to end the Russia-Ukraine war. The US is dispatching two negotiators to Moscow to meet Vladimir Putin. But who has Trump appointed for this important task? His old ‘golf buddy’ Steve Witkoff, who is also his West Asia special envoy, and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner
Read Full Article

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Interactive Webinar on


Law Related to Probation, Confirmation, Resignation and Termination of
Services of Employees


On

11th December 2025

11:00 AM to 05:00 PM

By

Mr. V Sharma

Corporate Trainer & Consultant HR

LLB, MBA-HR, PGD-PM&IR, PG Dip Labour Laws & Labour Welfare, Ph.D - Research
Scholar


Introduction:

The program would be of immense practical use for HR professionals and would
solve their many day-to-day problems and queries related to employment
matters.

In today's dynamic workplace environment, understanding the legal aspects
surrounding employee probation, confirmation, resignation, and termination
is crucial for both employers and HR professionals.

In the realm of employment law, the processes surrounding probation,
confirmation, resignation, and termination of services play a critical role
in defining the relationship between employers and employees. These
procedures serve as essential mechanisms for ensuring fairness,
accountability, and efficiency within the workforce.

Understanding the legal framework and procedural requirements surrounding
probation, confirmation, resignation, and termination of services is
essential for both employers and employees to navigate the complexities of
the employment relationship fairly and effectively. By adhering to these
laws and procedures, organizations can foster a culture of transparency,
accountability, and respect in the workplace, ultimately contributing to a
harmonious and productive working environment, besides avoiding a lot of
legal hassles and litigations.

This program aims to equip participants with a deep understanding of the
legal framework governing various aspects of employment, including
probationary periods, confirmation processes, resignation protocols, and
termination procedures.

Objective:

* Understanding of Legal Framework of Employment relationship:

Gain comprehensive knowledge of laws, regulations, and procedures governing
employment relationships, encompassing labour laws, contracts, & company
policies.

* Probationary Period Management:

Learn effective practices for managing probationary periods, including
establishing clear expectations, conducting performance evaluations, and
delivering feedback.

* Confirmation Processes:

Explore criteria and procedures for confirming employees post-probation,
ensuring fairness and compliance with legal standards.

* Resignation Protocols:

Understand legal and procedural aspects of employee resignation, covering
notice periods, exit interviews, withdrawl and acceptance of resignation.

* Termination Procedures:

Learn about termination grounds, due process requirements, documentation
protocols, and potential legal implications. Right to employee to challenge
termination in courts.

* Legal Compliance and Risk Management:

Strategies for ensuring compliance with employment laws, minimizing legal
risks, and resolving disputes effectively through alternative dispute
resolution mechanisms.

Who Should Attend:

*  Corporate HR Heads ( from Manufacturing and Service Industries)

*  HR Operations Heads/ Manager HR/ Personnel & Admin Managers

*  Compensation & Benefits Heads and Executives

*  Corporate Compliance Personnel

*  Business Heads of Small & medium Enterprises

*  Labour Law Practitioners and Compliance Personnel

 

Contents

* Overview of Employment Laws: Introduction to relevant labour laws,
regulations, and legal principles governing employer - employee
relationships.

 

* Understanding Probationary Period: Concept, purpose and duration of
probation. Extension of Probation and Termination services during probation.
Rights and benefits to an employee during probation period.

 

* Confirmation Procedures: Guidance on the process and criteria for
confirming employees, including legal considerations and documentation.
Deemed confirmation. Status on employment upon confirmation.

 

* Resignation Protocols: Employees' rights and obligations when resigning
from employment, notice periods, exit interviews, and legal implications for
employers. Withdrawl of resignation and acceptance of resignation.

 

* Grounds for Termination: Examining valid grounds for termination,
including misconduct, poor performance, redundancy, and other legitimate
reasons.

 

* Due Process in Termination: Procedural fairness in termination, conducting
investigations, providing opportunities thru' Domestic Equiry Process.
Adherence to legal requirements. The Principles of Natural Justice.

 

* Case Studies and Legal Precedents: Practical analysis of real-life cases
and legal precedents related to probation, confirmation, resignation and
termination. Reference of about 100 important / relevant High Court &
Supreme Court Cases.

 

* Documentation and Record-Keeping: Best practices for maintaining records,
documentation of employee performance, disciplinary actions, and termination
processes to ensure legal compliance and mitigate legal risks


Profile of Faculty

Mr. V Sharma - Corporate Trainer & Consultant HR

LLB, MBA-HR, PGD-PM&IR, PG Dip Labour Laws & Labour Welfare, Ph.D - Research
Scholar

Mr V Sharma having 25 years of professional experience in reputed industries
in which he worked at senior positions as HR & IR Heads at Lakshmi
Precisions, Talbros Automotive Components, Vikas Group- Faridabad, JBM
Group, Havells India Ltd., and Aisin Automotive Haryana Pvt Ltd.

Since last 3 years, has organised 100+ Training Programs on Labour and
Employment Laws across India, related to Changes & Updates on Labour Laws,
New Labour Codes, Disciplinary Action & Domestic Enquiry, Contract Labour
Management and Laws related to Shops and Establishments.

He has been a regular Trainer on various programs including Labour &
Industrial Laws, Contract Labour Management, Factories Act, Gender
Sensitivity (POSH), Environmental Laws and Interviewing Skills and
Personality Development etc.

Besides being a regular trainer, he has been visiting faculty at Jamia
Milaia Islamia University and GLA University, Mathura.


Pre-requisites

You should have good internet connection and good quality headphone/speaker
set with Laptop / Desktop.

You should have notepad/pen to note down important points.


How To Register


Fee Structure: - Per participant

Rs. 5500/-

USD 91

----18% GST is applicable

> Fees include certificate of participation & Course Material.

*Terms & Conditions apply

 

Best regards

For GFORD Institute of Management Pvt Ltd

Deepak Kapoor

For Booking seats Email us : gfordseminar@outlook.com 

Mob. : 9711114779 / 9315556407

For Query and nominations - 9540012349 only Whatsapp

For unsubscribe from the mailing list, please mail us on
gfordremoving@gmail.com

 

 

 


--

and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is 
intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If 
you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any

resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

notes.body: Hello Kshitij,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #652940318256898048-21279, I am sorry to know you have not received your ordered medicine LUPOXA STRIP OF 10 CAPSULES of 1 quantity, A TO Z NS PLUS STRIP OF 15 TABLE of 2 quantities, and FOLITRAX 15MG STRIP OF 5 TABLETS of 1 quantity. This is certainly not the kind of experience that we wanted you to have with our services. I apologize for the inconvenience caused to you.     I have highlighted the issue to our partner retailer. The issue is being investigated; this will take 24-48 hours from the time of reporting the issue. Once the issue is verified, we will try to initiate a refund for the missing medicines. We will inform you of the status once we receive an update from our partner retailer.     Once the refund is initiated, it will reflect in your PharmEasy wallet within 24 hours. Also, please confirm whether the order was delivered in intact condition.     I appreciate your patience in the meantime.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal

notes.body: Hello Siddharth,      Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is with regards to your order #572863799969792000-35020. We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you with your order.     As per the update received from our team, please be informed that strong feedback has been shared with the respective departments for dispatching the wrong product in your order, and we are also working to solve the issue on a priority basis. PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. Please note that we have raised a return request for the ACCU-CHEK ACTIVE GLUCOMETER TEST STRIPS BOX OF 50 of 1 quantity.     Please note that the medicine will be collected within 24 hours from the day the request is raised. Once the medicine is returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. The refund will be processed and initiated within 24-48 hours. Also, once the refund is initiated, it will reflect in your payment source in 5-7 business days.     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal
